question: 老眼
sourceMnemonic: An <kanji>elderly</kanji> <kanji>eyeball</kanji> is one that can't see things close up. That's why this word means <vocabulary>farsightedness</vocabulary>. But this is the kind of farsightedness that only comes with age. So you have to be an elderly oldey to have <ja>老眼</ja>.
sourceReadingMnemonic: This is a jukugo word that uses the on'yomi readings of the kanji. You should be able to read this on your own.
